Lompoc, CA Population by Race & Ethnicity

Racial distribution of Lompoc population: 50.66% are white, 3.61% are Black or African American, 2.30% are American Indian and Alaska Native, 3.60% are Asian, 0.24% are Native Hawaiian and other Pacific Islander, 18.22% are some other race and 21.37% are multiracial.

By Neilsberg Research

Updated Jul 15, 2024

Lompoc, CA population by race

The table below shows Lompoc's population by race.

Race Population % of Total Population White 22,334 50.66% Black or African American 1,592 3.61% American Indian and Alaska Native 1,014 2.30% Asian 1,587 3.60% Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander 106 0.24% Some other race 8,032 18.22% Two or more races (multiracial) 9,421 21.37%

TABLE OF CONTENTS

Lompoc population by race

Of the 5 race categories (excluding ethnicity) identified by the Census Bureau, namely American Indian or Alaska Native, Asian, Black or African American, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander and White; Lompoc has a population in all of the race categories.

This confirms that Lompoc's population has become increasingly diverse.

The percent distribution of Lompoc population by race (across all racial categories recognized by the U.S. Census Bureau): 50.66% are white, 3.61% are Black or African American, 2.30% are American Indian and Alaska Native, 3.60% are Asian, 0.24% are Native Hawaiian and other Pacific Islander, 18.22% are some other race and 21.37% are multiracial.

FIGURE 1

Lompoc, CA population by race.

The largest racial group in Lompoc is White with a population of 22,334 (50.66% of the total population).

Lompoc 's racial breakdown clearly shows that there is an absolute majority (i.e. more than 50% of the population belong to one particular race) of White population in the city.

As per the latest data estimates from American Community Survey's 5-year estimates:

1. The largest racial group in Lompoc is White with a population of 22,334 (50.66% of the total population).

2. The multiracial population, i.e. population that identify themselves with two or more races , is 9,421 (21.37% of the total population).

Racial / Ethnic makeup of Lompoc, CA

By ethnicity, 27,012 (61.27% of the total population) is Hispanic or Latino (of any race), and 17,074 (38.73% of the total population) is Non-Hispanic.

Of the Non-Hispanic population in Lompoc, the largest racial group is White alone with a population of 12,604 (73.82% of the total Non-Hispanic population).

FIGURE 2

Lompoc, CA Non-Hispanic population by race

All percentages shown below are, % of Lompoc's Non-Hispanic population.

Lompoc Non-Hispanic population by race

The distribution of the Non-Hispanic population across various race categories

Race Population % of Total Non-Hispanic Population White alone 12,604 73.82% Black or African American alone 1,435 8.40% American Indian and Alaska Native alone 217 1.27% Asian alone 1,499 8.78% Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone 48 0.28% Some other race alone 58 0.34% Two or more races (multiracial) 1,213 7.10%

Exploring Lompoc's Diversity? Request Customized Data Now!

Among the Hispanic population in Lompoc, regardless of the race, the largest group is of Mexican origin, with a population of 23,901 (88.48% of the total Hispanic population).

FIGURE 3

Lompoc, CA Hispanic or Latino population

All percentages shown below are, % of Lompoc's Hispanic population.

Lompoc Hispanic or Latino population

The distribution of the Hispanic or Latino population by their ancestries

Origin Population % of Total Hispanic Population Mexican 23,901 88.48% Puerto Rican 259 0.96% Cuban 33 0.12% Other Hispanic or Latino 2,819 10.44%

Exploring Lompoc's Diversity? Request Customized Data Now!

Things to know

What percentage of Lompoc, CA is Hispanic?

As per the U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey estimates, 61.27% of Lompoc population is Hispanic.

Among the Hispanic population in Lompoc, regardless of the race, the largest group is of Mexican origin, with a population of 23,901 (88.48% of the total Hispanic population).

How many Black people does Lompoc, CA have?

Lompoc, CA has 1,592 Black or African American population as per the estimates from the latest American Community Survey 5-Year estimates. Overall 3.61% of the total population (excluding multiracial) in Lompoc is Black.

What is the largest minority group in Lompoc, CA?

With 61.27% of the total population, Hispanic and Latino Americans are the largest ethnic minority in Lompoc.

That being said, with a 18.22% of the total population, Some other races are the largest racial minority in Lompoc.

What is the majority race in Lompoc, CA?

With a population of 22,334 (50.66% of the total population), Whites are the largest racial majority in Lompoc.

Some other races are second largest race in Lompoc, with 18.22% of the total population.

References

U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey (ACS) 2018-2022 5-Year Estimates

Notes

The analysis presented in this article is based on estimates derived from the U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey. While these figures offer valuable insights, they are subject to a margin of error. It is advisable to exercise caution and consider the potential margin of error when interpreting and utilizing this data.

Datasets

Explore datasets by year of publication.

2024

Lompoc, CA Population Breakdown By Race (Excluding Ethnicity) Dataset: Population Counts and Percentages for 7 Racial Categories as Identified by the US Census Bureau // 2024 Edition

Last updated July 7, 2024

About this dataset

Context

The dataset tabulates the population of Lompoc by race. It includes the population of Lompoc across racial categories (excluding ethnicity) as identified by the Census Bureau. The dataset can be utilized to understand the population distribution of Lompoc across relevant racial categories.

Key observations

The percent distribution of Lompoc population by race (across all racial categories recognized by the U.S. Census Bureau): 50.66% are white, 3.61% are Black or African American, 2.30% are American Indian and Alaska Native, 3.60% are Asian, 0.24% are Native Hawaiian and other Pacific Islander, 18.22% are some other race and 21.37% are multiracial.

Content

When available, the data consists of estimates from the U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey (ACS) 2018-2022 5-Year Estimates.

Racial categories include:

White

Black or African American

American Indian and Alaska Native

Asian

Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander

Some other race

Two or more races (multiracial)

Variables / Data Columns

Race: This column displays the racial categories (excluding ethnicity) for the Lompoc

Population: The population of the racial category (excluding ethnicity) in the Lompoc is shown in this column.

% of Total Population: This column displays the percentage distribution of each race as a proportion of Lompoc total population. Please note that the sum of all percentages may not equal one due to rounding of values.

Good to know

Margin of Error

Data in the dataset are based on the estimates and are subject to sampling variability and thus a margin of error. Neilsberg Research recommends using caution when presening these estimates in your research.

Custom data

If you do need custom data for any of your research project, report or presentation, you can contact our research staff at research@neilsberg.com for a feasibility of a custom tabulation on a fee-for-service basis.

Lompoc, CA Hispanic or Latino Population Distribution by Ancestries Dataset : Detailed Breakdown of Hispanic or Latino Origins // 2024 Edition

Last updated July 7, 2024

About this dataset

Context

The dataset tabulates the Lompoc Hispanic or Latino population. It includes the distribution of the Hispanic or Latino population, of Lompoc, by their ancestries, as identified by the Census Bureau. The dataset can be utilized to understand the origin of the Hispanic or Latino population of Lompoc.

Key observations

Among the Hispanic population in Lompoc, regardless of the race, the largest group is of Mexican origin, with a population of 23,901 (88.48% of the total Hispanic population).

Content

When available, the data consists of estimates from the U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey (ACS) 2018-2022 5-Year Estimates.

Origin for Hispanic or Latino population include:

Mexican

Puerto Rican

Cuban

Other Hispanic or Latino

Variables / Data Columns

Origin: This column displays the origin for Hispanic or Latino population for the Lompoc

Population: The population of the specific origin for Hispanic or Latino population in the Lompoc is shown in this column.

% of Total Hispanic Population: This column displays the percentage distribution of each Hispanic origin as a proportion of Lompoc total Hispanic or Latino population. Please note that the sum of all percentages may not equal one due to rounding of values.

Good to know
